intro: Marginaria plebeja var. rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's marginalia, is a lesser-known flowering plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that typically display shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
